metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14895 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in the Linux kernel, allversions 3.x.x and 4.x.x before 4.18.0, in Marvell WiFi chip driver. Theflaw could occur when the station attempts a connection negotiation duringthe handling of the remote devices country settings. This could allow theremote device to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possiblyexecute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14895` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-171.200
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-171.200
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1064.71
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1100.111
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1066.71
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1052.56
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1127-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1127.136
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1131-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1131.139
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-171.200').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1064.71').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1100.111').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.71').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.56').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.136').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1131.139').
